document.heading: RETIRED POLICE OFFICER REDEPLOYMENT SALARY LIMIT AMENDMENT ACT OF 1994

history.narrative: Law 10-170, the ‘Retired Police Officer Redeployment Salary Limit Amendment Act of 1994,‘ was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-471, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 21, 1994, and July 5, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 25, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-290 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-170 became effective on September 22, 1994.

L. 93-198 "the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. I0-471 on first and second readings, June 21, 1994 and July 5, 1994, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on July 25, 1994, this legislation was assigned Act No. I0-290, and published in the August 5, 1994, edition of the D.C. Register (Vol.41 page 5147) and transmitted to Congress on July 28, 1994 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(I) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C, Law lO-170 effective September 22, I~94 \-DAVID A. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTI~ICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "l~etired Police Officer P~edeployment Salary Limit Amendment Act of 1994 See. 2. Section 2(d) of the l~etired Police Officer l~edeployment Amendment Act of 1992, effective September 29, 1992 (D.C. Law 9-163; to be codified at D.C. Code § 4-618.1 is amended by striking the phrase "Class 1, Step I Officer" and inserting the phrase "Class 1, Step 5 Officer" in its place. Sec. 3. Effective date. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental l~eorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Star. 813; D.C.
